rules.title: Remove redundant guards
rules.description: Remove redundant guard conditions that do not affect behavior.
rules.details: Find branches such as always-true guards or duplicate checks that can be simplified safely.

rules.title: Refactor code to follow DRY principles
rules.description: Reduce duplicated logic by consolidating repeated patterns.
rules.details: Look for repeated code blocks that can be extracted into shared helpers without changing functionality.

rules.title: Harden code with better error handling
rules.description: Improve reliability through explicit error handling and propagation.
rules.details: Identify ignored errors, weak error context, and missing failure paths; strengthen handling while preserving behavior.

rules.title: Gate features behind environment variables
rules.description: Allow behavior to be controlled by environment flags.
rules.details: Where appropriate, introduce env-guarded behavior for risky or optional features.

rules.title: Split up functions into reusable pieces
rules.description: Break large functions into smaller, reusable units.
rules.details: Identify long or multi-responsibility functions and extract cohesive sub-functions.

rules.title: Standardize inconsistent naming styles
rules.description: Normalize inconsistent variable, function, and type naming.
rules.details: Apply a consistent naming style within files/modules while preserving public API expectations.

rules.title: Simplify complex logic while retaining functionality
rules.description: Reduce complexity in branching and control flow.
rules.details: Refactor overly complex logic into clearer structures and helper functions when needed.

rules.title: Detect expensive functions and offer ideas to improve performance
rules.description: Identify expensive code paths and suggest improvements.
rules.details: Look for nested loops, repeated heavy operations, and hot paths; provide optimization suggestions.
